knfOptions.label: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
knfOptions.placeholder: e.g., Sweet Potato Tips, Banana Stems

recipeData.name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
recipeData.description: A potent growth enhancer made from the fermented extracts of fast-growing plants.
ingredients: 1 part brown sugar or molasses (by weight)
steps: Mix thoroughly with an equal weight of brown sugar.
Pack tightly into a jar, cover with a breathable cloth.
Let it ferment in a cool, dark place for about 7 days.
recipeData.usage: Dilute 1:500 to 1:1000 with water for foliar spray or soil drench during vegetative growth.

recipeData.name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
recipeData.description: A nitrogen-rich fertilizer made from fermented fish parts, excellent for boosting growth and flavor.
ingredients: 1 part brown sugar or molasses (by weight)
steps: Layer fish scraps and brown sugar in a jar.
Cover with a breathable cloth and store in a cool, dark place.
Let it ferment for 3-6 months. Strain the liquid.
The resulting liquid is a potent source of nitrogen.
recipeData.usage: Dilute 1:1000 with water for soil drenching during active growth stages.

familyFarmPage.title: 200sqm Integrated Family Farm Model
familyFarmPage.description: A holistic, closed-loop system for food security and income generation on a small plot of land.
familyFarmPage.intro: This model, inspired by sustainable and permaculture principles, demonstrates how a small 10m x 20m area can be transformed into a productive ecosystem. It integrates crop cultivation, small animal husbandry, and resource recycling to create a self-sufficient family farm.
familyFarmPage.diagramCaption: Diagram illustrating the layout of the 200sqm model.

zones.title: Overall Layout & Design
description: The 200sqm (10m x 20m) plot is designed for maximum efficiency and synergy between different components. The layout prioritizes water flow, sun exposure, and ease of access.
It is a closed-loop system where waste from one component becomes a valuable input for another, minimizing external dependencies and costs.

subSections.title: Integration
content: Chicken manure fertilizes the vegetable beds. Pond water is used for irrigation. Kitchen scraps feed the chickens and worms. This integration reduces waste and enhances productivity.

subSections.title: Intensive Production
content: Utilizes techniques like vertical gardening, intercropping, and succession planting to maximize food production in a limited space.

zones.title: Vegetable & Crop Beds
description: The core of the food production, these raised beds are intensively managed using organic and Farming God's Way (FGW) principles. A diverse range of vegetables, legumes, and root crops are grown year-round to ensure a continuous supply of nutritious food.
Techniques like mulching (God's Blanket) are heavily used to conserve water, suppress weeds, and build soil fertility.

details.title: Crops Grown
content: Staples like maize, beans, and sweet potatoes.
High-value vegetables: tomatoes, kale, spinach, carrots.

details.title: Fertility Management
content: Regular application of compost from the compost pile and vermicompost.
Use of KNF inputs like Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ) for growth enhancement.

zones.title: Small Livestock: Chickens & Fish
zones.imageAlt: Chickens pecking in a coop and a small pond
description: A small flock of chickens (5-10) is kept for eggs and meat. Their enclosure is designed to be mobile or deep-litter to easily harvest nutrient-rich manure.
A small pond (approx. 2m x 3m) is integrated to raise fish like tilapia, providing a source of protein. The pond also acts as a water reservoir and habitat for beneficial insects.

details.title: Chicken System
content: Provides eggs, meat, and high-nitrogen fertilizer.
Fed with kitchen scraps and locally sourced grains, reducing feed costs.

details.title: Aquaculture Pond
content: Nutrient-rich pond water is used to irrigate vegetable beds.

zones.title: Resource Recycling: Compost & Vermicompost
zones.imageAlt: A compost pile and a worm bin
description: Nothing goes to waste in the integrated family farm model. A dedicated area is used for composting all farm and household organic waste.
A vermicompost (worm farm) bin is also maintained to produce high-quality worm castings, an excellent soil amendment and natural fertilizer.

details.title: Compost Pile
content: Breaks down crop residues, animal manure, and kitchen scraps into humus-rich compost to build soil health.

details.title: Vermicompost Bin
content: Earthworms efficiently convert organic waste into nutrient-dense vermicast and 'worm tea' liquid fertilizer.

conclusion.title: A Model for Resilience & Prosperity
content: The 200sqm Integrated Family Farm is more than just a method of farming; it's a pathway to self-sufficiency, improved nutrition, and economic resilience for smallholder families.
By adopting these principles, families can significantly reduce their food expenses, generate surplus income, and build a healthier environment for future generations.
DamDoh is committed to supporting farmers in adopting and adapting such sustainable models.

fgwGuidePage.title: Guide to Farming God's Way (FGW)
fgwGuidePage.description: Learn the core principles of this high-yield, no-till, sustainable farming methodology.
fgwGuidePage.intro: Farming God's Way is a resource-saving farming method that seeks to honor God by being faithful stewards of the land. It focuses on minimal soil disturbance, heavy mulching, and high standards to achieve excellent yields with low input costs, transforming livelihoods and restoring creation.

principles.title: No Mechanical Tillage
principles.summary: Instead of ploughing the entire field, the soil is left undisturbed. Permanent planting stations are used year after year.
howTo: Mark out permanent planting stations at the correct spacing for your crop.
Dig holes only at these stations, not across the whole field.
Apply compost and fertilizer directly into the holes.
Plant your seeds or seedlings in these prepared stations.
whyItWorks: Prevents soil erosion from wind and water.
Protects the soil's natural structure and ecosystem (worms, fungi).
Saves significant labor, time, and fuel costs from ploughing.
principles.imageAlt: A field with planting stations instead of ploughed furrows

principles.title: 100% Mulch Cover (God's Blanket)
principles.summary: The soil is always covered with a thick layer of organic material (mulch), just as God covers the forest floor with leaves.
howTo: Gather dry organic matter like grass, straw, or maize stalks.
Apply a thick blanket (at least 4-6 inches) over the entire soil surface between planting stations.
Never burn crop residues; use them for the blanket.
Continuously add to the blanket as it decomposes.
whyItWorks: Drastically reduces water evaporation, conserving moisture.
Suppresses weed growth, reducing labor for weeding.
Feeds the soil as it breaks down, building fertility.
Regulates soil temperature, protecting plant roots.
principles.imageAlt: A field covered in a thick layer of mulch

principles.title: Practice with High Standards
principles.summary: Doing everything on time and with excellence, from planting to harvesting, to maximize the potential God has placed in the land.
howTo: Plant on time at the start of the rains.
Use precise spacing and planting depths.
Harvest at the optimal time to ensure quality and reduce losses.
whyItWorks: Ensures the crop gets the full benefit of the rainy season.
Avoids overcrowding and gives each plant the best chance to thrive.
Maximizes yield and profitability from your plot.
Honors God by doing your work with diligence.
principles.imageAlt: A farmer carefully planting seeds in a well-prepared station

seedStartingPage.title: Seed Starting Guide & Calculator
seedStartingPage.description: Plan your planting schedule for a successful harvest by starting seeds at the right time.
seedStartingPage.intro: Starting seeds indoors gives your crops a head start, protects them from pests and harsh weather when they are most vulnerable, and allows you to get an earlier harvest. This guide helps you determine when to start your seeds based on your local last frost date.

sections.title: Why Start Seeds Indoors?
sections.intro: Starting seeds indoors, or 'transplanting', offers several key advantages over planting directly in the garden (direct sowing).

points.def: Get a jump on the season by having mature seedlings ready to plant as soon as the weather is favorable.
Young seedlings are protected from pests, diseases, and unpredictable weather during their most fragile stage.
You can control the temperature, light, and moisture to ensure a higher germination rate.
Planting established seedlings into a prepared bed makes it easier to manage weeds compared to waiting for tiny seeds to sprout.

sections.title: What You'll Need
sections.intro: You don't need expensive equipment to get started. Here are the basics:

points.def: Seed trays, peat pots, soil blocks, or even recycled containers like yogurt cups (with drainage holes).
A light, sterile mix is better than heavy garden soil for germination. You can buy a mix or make your own.
A sunny, south-facing window is good, but a simple fluorescent shop light or LED grow light is best to prevent seedlings from becoming 'leggy'.
A spray bottle for gentle watering and a warm location (or a heat mat) to encourage germination.

sections.title: When to Start Your Seeds
sections.intro: The key to timing is your area's 'Average Last Frost Date'. This is the average date of the last light freeze in spring. You can usually find this online by searching for your city or region.
steps: Step 1: Find Your Last Frost Date. Enter your location into a search engine (e.g., 'last frost date Nairobi').
Step 2: Check Your Seed Packet. Look for instructions like 'Start indoors 6-8 weeks before last frost'.
Step 3: Count Backwards. From your last frost date, count back the recommended number of weeks on a calendar. That's your target seed-starting date!
Example: Last Frost is May 15th. Seed packet says 'Start 6 weeks before'. Counting back 6 weeks gives you a start date of April 3rd.

about.title: About DamDoh
about.subtitle: Our Mission, Vision, and the Values that drive us.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: Our mission is to empower the global agricultural industry by creating a transparent, efficient, and sustainable supply chain. We connect farmers, buyers, service providers, and other stakeholders to foster growth, reduce waste, and ensure food security for all.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.content: We envision a world where every farmer, regardless of their size or location, has access to the tools, knowledge, and markets they need to thrive. We aim to be the operating system for global agriculture, fostering trust, collaboration, and prosperity for all participants.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.content: We are committed to practices that protect the planet and ensure the long-term viability of agriculture.

collaboration.title: Collaboration
collaboration.content: We believe that agriculture's biggest challenges can be solved through cooperation and shared knowledge.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.content: We leverage technology to solve real-world problems, drive efficiency, and create new opportunities.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.content: We operate with honesty and transparency, building trust in every aspect of our platform.

empowerment.title: Empowerment
empowerment.content: We provide the tools and information users need to make informed decisions and grow their businesses.

team.title: Our Team
team.intro: DamDoh is led by a diverse team of technologists, agronomists, and business professionals with a shared passion for agriculture.
team.member1Bio: Agricultural economist with a vision to use technology to solve global food challenges.

careers.title: Careers at DamDoh
careers.subtitle: Join us in shaping the future of agriculture.

whyWorkWithUs.title: Why Work With Us?
whyWorkWithUs.intro: Joining DamDoh means being part of a mission-driven organization making a real-world impact. We offer:
whyWorkWithUs.point1: A collaborative and innovative work environment.
whyWorkWithUs.point2: Opportunities to work on challenging problems with global impact.
whyWorkWithUs.point3: A commitment to professional growth and development.
whyWorkWithUs.point5: A culture that values diversity, inclusion, and work-life balance.

job1.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Logistics)
job1.description: Design and build the backend services that power our logistics and supply chain optimization tools.

job2.title: Product Manager, Farmer Tools
job2.description: Lead the development of our farm management suite, ensuring it is intuitive and impactful for farmers globally.

job3.title: Community Manager (Francophone)
job3.description: Engage and support our growing community of French-speaking users across West Africa.

noOpenings.title: No Open Positions
noOpenings.content1: We don't have any open positions at the moment, but we're always interested in hearing from talented individuals. Send your resume to {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Our commitment to a safe, trusted, and professional community.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! To ensure this remains a productive and respectful space for everyone, we ask that you follow these guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful
respectful.description: Treat all members with respect and professionalism. Personal attacks, harassment, or hate speech will not be tolerated.

authentic.title: Be Authentic
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business honestly. Do not use fake profiles or provide misleading information.

relevant.title: Stay On Topic
relevant.description: Keep discussions and posts relevant to agriculture, food supply chains, and related topics. Spam or self-promotion outside of the marketplace is not permitted.

fairTrade.title: Transact Fairly
fairTrade.description: Conduct business with integrity. Honor agreements, represent products accurately, and communicate clearly and honestly.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: We encourage discussions and practices that promote environmental, social, and economic sustainability in agriculture.

reporting.title: Report Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our support team at {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: Thank you for being part of a trusted and professional global agricultural community.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: We'd love to hear from you! Here's how you can reach us.

sendMessage.title: Send a Message
sendMessage.note: This is a placeholder form. Please use the email addresses for real inquiries.

helpCenterPage.subtitle: Find answers to your questions

gettingStarted.description: Learn how to set up your account, create your profile, and start navigating the platform.

marketplaceGuide.description: Detailed instructions on creating listings, buying items, and managing transactions securely.

accountManagement.placeholder: Account Management guides will appear here.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Solutions to common issues and troubleshooting tips.

stillNeedHelp.title: Still Need Help?
stillNeedHelp.description: Our support team is ready to assist you with any questions.

industryNewsPage.title: Industry News & Trends
industryNewsPage.description: Stay informed on the latest in agricultural technology, market prices, and global supply chains.

news1.title: Global Coffee Prices Hit 18-Month High Amid Supply Chain Woes
news1.excerpt: Logistical bottlenecks in South America and adverse weather in Southeast Asia have pushed coffee futures to their highest levels since early 2022.

news2.title: EU Introduces New Sustainable Packaging Regulations for Imported Foodstuffs
news2.excerpt: Beginning in January 2025, all agricultural imports into the European Union will need to meet new, stricter standards for recyclable and compostable packaging.

news3.title: Study Shows Regenerative Agriculture Boosts Soil Water Retention by up to 25%
news3.excerpt: A long-term study by the Global Agriculture Institute reveals that no-till and cover cropping practices significantly improve the soil's ability to retain water, increasing drought resilience.

noNews.title: No News Articles
noNews.description: There are no news articles available at the moment. Please check back later.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.introduction: Welcome to DamDoh. We are committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information.

whatInfoWeCollect.heading: What Information Do We Collect?
whatInfoWeCollect.content: We collect information you provide directly to us, such as when you create an account, and information automatically collected, such as usage data and cookies.

howWeUseInfo.heading: How Do We Use Your Information?
howWeUseInfo.content: We use your information to provide, operate, and improve our services, to communicate with you, to process transactions, and to secure our platform.

willInfoBeShared.heading: Will Your Information Be Shared With Anyone?
willInfoBeShared.content: We only share information with your consent, to comply with laws, to provide you with services, to protect your rights, or to fulfill business obligations.

cookiesAndTracking.heading: Do We Use Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies?
cookiesAndTracking.content: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies to access or store information to enhance and personalize your website experience.

howLongWeKeepInfo.heading: How Long Do We Keep Your Information?
howLongWeKeepInfo.content: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy policy unless otherwise required or permitted by law.

howWeKeepInfoSafe.heading: How Do We Keep Your Information Safe?
howWeKeepInfoSafe.content: We have implemented a variety of organizational and technical security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process.

minors.heading: Do We Collect Information From Minors?
minors.content: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age.

privacyRights.heading: What Are Your Privacy Rights?
privacyRights.content: In some regions, you may have certain rights under applicable data protection laws. These may include the right to access and control your personal information.

controlsForDoNotTrack.heading: Controls for Do-Not-Track Features
controlsForDoNotTrack.content: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems include a Do-Not-Track ('DNT') feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected.

updatesToNotice.heading: Do We Make Updates to This Notice?
updatesToNotice.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated 'Revised' date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.introduction: Welcome to DamDoh! These Terms of Service govern your use of our website and services.

agreementToTerms.heading: 1. Agreement to Terms
agreementToTerms.content: By using our services, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, do not use the services.

intellectualProperty.heading: 2. Intellectual Property Rights
intellectualProperty.content: Unless otherwise indicated, the Site is our proprietary property and all source code, databases, functionality, software, website designs, audio, video, text, photographs, and graphics on the Site are owned or controlled by us or licensed to us.

userRepresentations.heading: 3. User Representations
userRepresentations.content: By using the Site, you represent and warrant that: (1) all registration information you submit will be true, accurate, current, and complete; (2) you have the legal capacity and you agree to comply with these Terms of Use.

prohibitedActivities.heading: 4. Prohibited Activities
prohibitedActivities.content: You may not access or use the Site for any purpose other than that for which we make the Site available. The Site may not be used in connection with any commercial endeavors except those that are specifically endorsed or approved by us.

platformManagement.heading: 5. Platform Management
platformManagement.content: We reserve the right, but not the obligation, to: (1) monitor the Site for violations of these Terms of Use; (2) take appropriate legal action against anyone who, in our sole discretion, violates the law or these Terms of Use.

termAndTermination.heading: 6. Term and Termination
termAndTermination.content: These Terms of Use shall remain in full force and effect while you use the Site. WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO, IN OUR SOLE DISCRETION AND WITHOUT NOTICE OR LIABILITY, DENY ACCESS TO AND USE OF THE SITE.

modificationsAndInterruptions.heading: 7. Modifications and Interruptions
modificationsAndInterruptions.content: We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of the Site at any time or for any reason at our sole discretion without notice. We cannot guarantee the Site will be available at all times.

governingLaw.heading: 8. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms shall be governed by and defined following the laws of Kenya, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

disputeResolution.heading: 9. Dispute Resolution
disputeResolution.content: Any legal action of whatever nature brought by either you or us shall be commenced or prosecuted in the courts located in Nairobi, Kenya.

contactUs.heading: 10. Contact Us
contactUs.content: In order to resolve a complaint regarding the Site or to receive further information regarding use of the Site, please contact us.

termsOfService.conclusion: Please {contactLink} if you have any questions.
